alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Gaston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 16 at 8:01PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following counties, Cleveland and Gaston. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 PM EDT, Rainfall has ended across the area. However, runoff from the earlier heavy rainfall is keeping high water levels across the area. Minor flooding is ongoing. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shelby, Kings Mountain, Cherryville, Bessemer City, Grover, Patterson Springs, Fallston, Waco, Earl, Crowders Mountain State Park, Kings Mountain State Park and Crouse. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
